body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.7.0-dev+1453-g8486c87e5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

macOS 12.3.1

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.10.1

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

Manually compiled

### How to reproduce the issue

I ran into this issue while implementing filewatch for LSP, so I actually saw this issue in a callback for fs_event, but it's easier to reproduce in a snippet with a timer.

```
% cat >file.lua
local re = vim.regex("^.*\\.go$")

local timer = vim.loop.new_timer()
timer:start(200, 200, function()
  local files = {
    "internal/config/config.go";
  }
  for _, file in ipairs(files) do
    if re:match_str(file) then
      print("it matches!")
    end
  end
end)
^-D
% nvim -E --clean 'source file.lua'
# after some time:
Entering Ex mode.  Type "visual" to go to Normal mode.
:zsh: abort      nvim --clean -E +'source file.lua'
```

(can also repro in non Ex mode, just sharing those instructions for simplicity).

Note: If I `vim.schedule_wrap` the callback it works fine, but my understanding is that that shouldn't be required for vim.regex? Let me know if my understanding is incorrect.

### Expected behavior

"it matches!" gets printed every 200ms.

### Actual behavior

Neovim crashes, terminal says:

```
:zsh: abort      nvim --clean -E +'source file.lua'
```

Crash report from Console.app says:


comment_data.body: For stacktraces with debug info, see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31681

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: crash: "abort() called" with `vim.regex():match_str` from a luv callback
